column4: 1 cup rolled oats; 2 medium bananas, sliced; 2 Tbsp peanut butter; 1 tsp cinnamon; 1 Tbsp honey (optional)
column5:
Pour oats into a pot.
Add 2?cups of water (or milk).
Stir and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and let it simmer until thick (?5?min).
Add sliced bananas, peanut butter, and cinnamon.
Stir until everything is warmed through.
Pour the mixture into two bowls.
Drizzle honey on top if you like it sweet.
Eat while warm.

column4: 4 eggs; 1 cup fresh spinach; 2 slices whole-grain bread; 1 tsp butter or oil; 1/4 tsp salt; 1/2 tsp black pepper; 1/4 tsp garlic powder; 1/4 tsp smoked paprika; 1/8 tsp dried oregano; pinch ground cumin
column5:
Whisk eggs in a bowl.
Heat butter in a pan.
Pour eggs into the pan.
Stir constantly until eggs are just set.
Add spinach to the eggs.
Stir until spinach wilts (?1?min).
Season with salt and pepper.
Toast bread slices.
Serve the scramble beside the toast.
Enjoy!

column4: 2 cups plain Greek yogurt; 1 cup mixed berries (blueberries, strawberries); 1/2 cup rolled oats; 1 Tbsp honey; 1 tsp cinnamon
column5:
Spoon half of the yogurt into a bowl.
Sprinkle half the oats on top.
Layer half the berries.
Repeat the layers.
Drizzle honey over the top.
Sprinkle cinnamon.
Chill for 5?min (optional).
Eat straight away.

column4: 1 cup whole-grian flour; 1 Tbsp sugar; 1 tsp baking powder; 1 tsp cinnamon; 1 cup milk (skim or soy); 1 egg; 1/2 cup diced apples; 1/2 Tbsp butter
column5:
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and cinnamon.
Beat milk, egg, and melted butter together.
Pour the wet mix into the dry mix.
Fold in apple pieces.
Heat a non?stick skillet over medium.
Drop ¼ cup batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form, flip, cook another 1?min.
Repeat with remaining batter.
Serve hot with fresh berries (optional).
Dig in!

column4: 2 corn tortillas; 2 eggs; 1/2 cup chopped bell pepper; 1/2 cup chopped carrots; 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese; 1 tsp oil (olive or avocado); 1/4 tsp garlic powder; 1/4 tsp smoked paprika; 1/2 tsp black pepper; 1/4 tsp dried oregano; pinch chili flakes (optional); 1 tsp lime juice
column5:
Heat oil in a pan.
Add bell pepper and carrots; sauté 2?min.
Push veggies to the edge and scramble the eggs into the pan.
Cook eggs until they’re just set.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet for 30?sec each side.
Sprinkle cheese over the egg mixture.
Spoon the mixture onto each tortilla. Drizzle 1/2 tsp lime juice over the filling.
Fold the sides and roll up.
Let it sit 1?min to melt cheese.
Eat warm.

column4: 1 banana; 2 Tbsp peanut butter; 1 cup soy milk; 1/2 cup oats; 1/4 tsp tumeric (optional)
column5:
Put banana, peanut butter, soy milk, oats, and turmeric in a blender.
Blend until smooth.
If too thick, add little more soy milk.
Pour into two glasses.
Drink right away.

column4: 6 eggs; 1/2 cup diced tomatoes; 1/2 cup chopped spinach; 1/4 cup shredded cheddar; 1/2 tsp ground cumin; 1/4 tsp garlic powder; 1/4 tsp pepper; 1/2 tsp smoked paprika; 1/4 tsp dried oregano; pinch of cayenne
column5:
Preheat oven to 350?°F (175?°C).
Whisk all eggs in a large bowl.
Stir in tomatoes, spinach, and cheese.
Grease a muffin tin lightly.
Spoon the mixture into 6 muffin cups, about ¾ full.
Bake 20?min until set.
Let cool 5?min.
Take out and serve.

column4: 2 cups plain yogurt; 1 cup diced apples; 1 cup blueberries; 1 Tbsp honey; 1 tsp ground cinnamon
column5:
Scoop yogurt into two bowls.
Top with apples and blueberries.
Drizzle honey.
Sprinkle cinnamon.
Mix if desired.
Eat!

column4: 1 cup cooked brown rice; 3 oz cooked chicken breast; 1/2 cup frozen peas; 1/2 cup frozen carrots; 1/4 cup low-sodium chicken broth; 1/4 tsp salt; 1/4 tsp pepper; 1/2 tsp paprika
column5:
Heat broth in a pot.
Add rice, peas, and carrots.
Simmer 5?min until veggies are tender.
Stir in chicken pieces.
Season with salt, pepper, paprika.
Cook 2?min more.
Divide into two bowls.
Serve!

column4: 2 slices whole-grain bread; 2 slices fresh tomato; 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella; 1 tsp olive oil; 1/4 tsp salt; 1/4 tsp pepper
column5:
Heat a skillet over medium.
Brush bread lightly with olive oil.
Place bread in the skillet, toast both sides.
Put tomato slices on hot toast.
Sprinkle cheese over tomatoes.
Cover the pan for 1?min to melt cheese.
Remove from heat.
Cut in half and serve.
